titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Jasper Sorrell, William Runnell, Thomas Kerrick, & David Downs, Indictment
CWG5176

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Bath Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Ky
agst } Indictment
Jasper Sorrell
William Runnell
Thos Kerrick
David Downs

The Grand Jury of Bath County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Jasper Sorrell, William Runnells, Thos Kerrick and David Downs for the offense of Robbery, Committed as follows "towit, The said Jasper Sorrell, William Runnells, Thos Kerrick and David Downs on the 1st day of July 1864 in the County & Circuit aforesaid did wilfully feloniously & Burgariously & with force of arms break open the Store House of Levi Fratman by putting in fear and danger of his life & without & against his will & consent did rob the said Store & take steal & carry away therefrom goods, Cottons & Clothing the amount and value of $150 00/100 the personal property of the said Fratman, Agaisnt the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Ky.

A Copy
Attest V.B. Young Clerk
$2000
The Comth
vs } Indictment for Robbery
Jasper Sorrell
William Runnells
Thos Kerrick
David DownsA TRUE BILL
J A Trumbo foremanComth witnesses
Levi Fratman
Travis Daniel
Jno Kembrough
Jas Nesbitt
Foward Sept 1862J.S. Dury Comth Atty
